So, we had around 50 min. to eat. We were going to order another round of cocktails and dessert. We said something to our waiter and he was even surprised. review_text: Walked in at 6:30 and the place was packed.  The music was a bit loud for us but the bar was hopping so Im guessing the music was just right for the rest of the patrons.  When we arrived we were greeted warmly by the host, who asked if we had a reservation.  We did not but she accommodated us and asked the we simply be done by 8:30 because she had someone who reserved our table at that time, otherwise the wait would have been 30-45 minutes. We sat down and the serve greeted us quickly and was very pleasant.  She took our drink order and app order and returned quickly with the beverages.  While she didnt make any recommendations, she did comment on all of our food choices saying that one in particular was her favorite.  The server checked in on us frequently and never left us waiting for her. The food was delicious!  The wings where perfectly spiced, the cheese steak spring roles came out hot and dripping with cheese.  Everyone at the table was very happy with their main courses (pasta, chicken, and salad). All in all a great experience!

review_text: Came here after work one evening to get an early dinner and a few drinks. They were very busy and I say at the bar. The food that I ordered was good. The beer was good. Service was truly bad. It was EXTREMELY hard to order a drink, harder still to order the food. A second drink eventually got ordered with the help of a random waitress that was dropping off some plates and noticed I was sitting with an empty glass and being ignored. Its possible that the bartenders see that I was alone and decided that I should be ignored strategically to maximize their tips? I like to think not, but I guess its possible. Definitely incorrect reasoning from them if that was the case, but I cant understand what else would explain it. (A couple sitting next to me had also been ignored though, and they were finding it quite funny) After drink 2 I gave up and spent the rest of my evening at another bar directly across the road where ordering wasnt a battle. Really annoyingly the food that I ordered was EXCELLENT and is the only reason this is 3 stars and not 1. I certainly wont ever go back under any circumstances, but its a shame

review_text: I Googled for a good place to eat near Madison Square Garden, and fortunately for us, the name came up. Looked over the menu and booked the reservations. Arrived early, and they were very accommodating, and sat us almost immediately. Waiter was great, well spaced everything, and then even gave us time to consider dessert. (Of course we split a slice of Limoncello cake and it was wonderful!) For dinner, we split the Cheese Steak Spring Rolls. They were delicious. For dinner we each had the Bacon wrapped Pork Loin. It was absolutely amazing. My husband and I are still raving about it, and it was over a week ago! On the way out, I realized I was developing a small blister (new shoes...dummy me) and the girls at the podium in the front of the restaurant were both so kind, and one got me a couple of bandaids. I havent been in this part of the city in so many years. I cant wait to schedule something at The Garden, so I have an excuse to come back. P.S. the Water Closets (bathrooms) were clean as well.

review_text: One of the best spinach and artichoke dips Ive ever had in my life. I could have eaten it with a spoon it was so good. There were limited gluten free options, so not everyone in my party had a variety of choices but everything ordered ranged from good to absolutely delicious (looking at you s&a dip!). The drinks menu was pretty varied and delicious. The bar itself is fun and casual with a locals only for the most part. Absolutely full before Rangers games so plan ahead. The dining area was VERY tightly squeezed in. There were a few more tables than there should be for people to be able to move freely, so I can imagine it being a problem for some. Its also very loud in there. The bar is super long, lots of TVs. Great for sports watching. Big negative - only one bathroom for the whole place. Not one per gender, just one single one. If there were more, then they were so well hidden that there may as well only be one, so if you think you have to go, get in line before you actually really need to go.

review_text: My co-workers and I went there for after work drinks celebrating our birthdays.  Reservations were made for a party of 6, and when we arrived we were told that they could not find the reservation.  We asked the Hostess if we could speak to the manager because she wasnt about to seat our party, even though we showed her the confirmation.  She actually hesitated...then went off to get him... Im not sure if she did because he never came over to us.  The hostess returns and then states she can seat us but that the HAPPY HOUR is not included. Huh? We asked why. She just said its not included again.  We asked to speak to the manager once again, she left the podium and wasnt gone 2 mins if that, and then stated that we can order happy hour drinks from our table. The waiter was nice and everything else was okay. Just okay.  Decor, food, atmosphere, okay. Im a Customer Service Instructor and the Gentlemen in my party were either Managers or Coordinators in the customer service industry and deal with the public on a daily basis.  We feel the Manager should have come out to greet us.  One of three things happened, the Hostess didnt notify the Manager or the Manager didnt want to deal with us, orrrr the hostess caught an attitude and didnt feel like dealing with us after they made the mistake with the reservation. Will I be going back? Probably not. First impressions are key.

review_text: Had reservations for 2 at 5:30. The bar was already pretty packed and its really loud in there. Hard to have a convo without yelling. Staff was friendly and attentive. Food came out at a good pace as well. The cocktails were boozy and excellent. The watermelon cosmo was refreshing and tasty. Also got the a martini which was equally as good. For apps we got the calamari. It was tender but the breading did not stay on very well. The sauce was a great addition though for flavor and the calamari was seasoned well. Said it was sweet and spicy but the spice was pretty absent. The surf and turf sliders were great. The shrimp on there was a great combo with the coleslaw and short rib. My fries were soggy though which was a bummer. The marscapone cake tasted like it was a typical frozen pre-made dessert. My friend later that night ended up not feeling well after her burger though which is really unfortunate. Probably wouldnt be back unless I was just getting drinks.

Came here for a quick lunch with the folks and sister. Didnt realize it was much more of a bar with seating in the back than a full restaurant with a bar. But it has good yelp reviews, so there we were. Inside, its really pretty with velvet wallpaper and old wood. No drinks for us this day but the food was pretty solid. For appetizer we shared the flatbread grilled with mozzarella, cherry tomatoes, arugula, and balsamic. Light and tasty - a good start to the meal. I had the three sliders - burger, crab cake, and shrimp. They asked me how Id like my burger slider cooked. Kind of an unexpected sophistication for a humble slider. And it came out as asked. The shrimp were plump and juicy and tasted real good in between the buns. And the buns were soft brioche and not stale as I feared. The crab cake was a bit disappointing since it wasnt really lump - but it didnt claim to be either. The sliders came with hand cut fries that were like Belgian frites.  Sis got the salmon - didnt try it but everyone said it was quite good. My parents shared the goddess salad. The server was more than happy to split it in the back for us - always a plus since some places are weird about that. The salad was very fresh with a variety of components. They opted to get it with grilled chicken. On the whole everyone enjoyed their meal. I think even more so because these food wasnt as salty as typical restaurants. These servers were pleasant but the dish clearing was a little aggressive, especially considering the place was only half full. Three entrees plus appetizer for lunch came out to around $70 + tip. High, but not terrible considering its Manhattan. Definitely a place worth checking out.
